messages.message:
I had synced the sandbox (https://instabase.sandboxes.site/sandboxes/jeminjain1) and restarted.
Still i faced the same issue.
Do i need to check the 'Force Update Base' as well while resyncing?
Did you restart all services as well?
Please check for this file: env-local-secrets.json. It’s in there.
we couldn't see the variables like 'ENABLE_READER_PAGE' and the other keys in there
Ok - can you move them to env-local.json then? I did my best to clean up the env vars to make them match prod, but there’s hundreds of them.
By the way, env-local-secrets only has secrets. Per the name.

env-local: general env vars
env-local-secrets: secrets only; autogenerated by crafting do not modify
env-local-crafting: non-secret crafting-specific host names and ports only; autogenerated by crafting
env-local-overrides: personal env var overrides; not checked into git

I am unsure of what all variables are necessary and need to be copied over given theres a lot of them, and i see there are couple of files in different services that have been deleted by this PR.
So is there an alternative way i can fix this quickly since this is affecting the testing in crafting env, do suggest
Currently i have reverted the commit to unblock myself.

There shouldn't be many. You ran into one -- did you attempt to reset that one env var?

--

FWIW, I got it working on my crafting sandbox (build and converse both worked). So, it sounds like a user-specific issue to me.
@Yash Aggarwal -- can we think about removing these env vars entirely? Noticed a TODO on one of them
